page.title: 01WESTBURY- A SUMMARY
page.content: Westbury has moved a very long way from the rural country town with its weekly wool market and finds itself become something of a centre for small manufacturing and light industrial companies with an expanding population of 7500. The reasons for this are the various small estates around the town but also its road links with the south coast, Bristol and the Midlands, whilst London itself is no more than two and a half hours away - one and a half by rail. It has strong connec- tions with the Army. Many new housing estates are being built to cater for the increased population and the area is well served with churches and chapels of many denominations. The three schools play their part in preparing the children to take their place in this new Westbury.
